quotes.message: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.message: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.message: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.message: He who fears death will never do anything worth of a man who is alive.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.message: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.message: Man is not worried by real problems so much as by his imagined anxieties about real problems.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.message: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.message: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.message: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.message: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.message: If it is not right, do not do it; if it is not true, do not say it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.message: How long are you going to wait before you demand the best for yourself?
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.message: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.message: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.message: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.message: He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.message: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.message: To improve is to change; to be perfect is to change often.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.message: It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.message: The willing are led by fate, the reluctant are dragged.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.message: Associate with people who are likely to improve you.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.message: No man is free who is not master of himself.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.message: He suffers more than necessary, who suffers before it is necessary.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.message: Let us train our minds to desire what the situation demands.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.message: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.message: Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.message: Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.message: The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you, whose presence calls forth your best.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.message: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.message: The greater the difficulty, the more glory in surmounting it.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.message: You become what you give your attention to.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.message: The wise man is neither raised up by prosperity nor cast down by adversity.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.message: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.message: If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favorable.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.message: What we fear doing most is usually what we most need to do.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.message: You could leave life right now. Let that determine what you do and say and think.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.message: Our life is what our thoughts make it.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.message: Stand out of my light.
quotes.author: Diogenes the Cynic
quotes.context: Said to Alexander the Great when the ruler asked if he could do anything for Diogenes.

quotes.message: I am looking for an honest man.
quotes.author: Diogenes the Cynic
quotes.context: Said while carrying a lamp in broad daylight.

quotes.message: In a rich man's house there is no place to spit but his face.
quotes.author: Diogenes the Cynic

quotes.message: The most beautiful thing in the world is freedom of speech.
quotes.author: Diogenes the Cynic

quotes.message: I am not an Athenian or a Greek, but a citizen of the world.
quotes.author: Diogenes the Cynic

quotes.message: Why not whip the teacher when the pupil misbehaves?
quotes.author: Diogenes the Cynic

quotes.message: Humans have complicated every simple gift of the gods.
quotes.author: Diogenes the Cynic

quotes.message: I threw my cup away when I saw a child drinking from his hands at the trough.
quotes.author: Diogenes the Cynic
